item.title: Metals Waver as Markets Look to Economic Data Releases
item.description: Base metals and gold ticked up, with investors eyeing the ECB monetary policy decision and U.S. GDP data as key price drivers.

item.title: Philippines Central Bank Unexpectedly Raises Policy Rate
item.description: The Philippine central bank unexpectedly raised its benchmark interest rate to rein in high inflation.

item.title: Unilever Outlines Shake-up Plans, Maintains Outlook
item.description: Unilever said it would focus on its main brands, shift from gross savings to net productivity and make several changes on the leadership team as part of the new CEO’s action plan, as the group confirmed its full-year guidance.

item.title: ECB Expected to Announce Balance Sheet Review
item.description: There is a high probability the ECB announces a balance sheet review to determine the amount of quantitative tightening required and for which programs, Neuberger Berman said.

item.title: Oil Slips as Dollar Rises
item.description: Oil prices slipped back, weighed by a stronger dollar and with Israel seemingly delaying its invasion of Gaza.

item.title: TotalEnergies Boosts Payout After Profit Rise
item.description: TotalEnergies posted a modest rise in third-quarter profit, helped by a supportive price environment and increased its shareholder distribution, including a third interim dividend for 2023.

item.title: Takeda Pharmaceutical Books Second-Quarter Net Loss
item.description: Takeda Pharmaceutical reported a second-quarter net loss due to impairment losses on certain products and cut its net-profit forecast for the fiscal year ending March 2024.

item.title: Unilever's Lack of Big Strategic Changes, Market Weakness Looks Worrying
item.description: Unilever’s third-quarter volumes missed expectations, but that was mostly driven by ice-cream sales which is less relevant given the hit from the weather but Citi said the lack of big strategic changes and market share weakness is more likely to weigh on the share price for now.

item.title: Mercedes-Benz Third Quarter Hit by Weaker Demand
item.description: Mercedes-Benz reported a 7% drop in third-quarter underlying earnings and weaker revenue, as lower passenger car sales and increased tech investments weighed.

item.title: Schneider Electric Keeps Outlook Despite Flat Revenue
item.description: Schneider Electric backed its full-year targets after reporting flattish third-quarter revenue that was just shy of analysts’ expectations and warning of signs of weaker demand for discrete automation in China and Western Europe.

item.title: STMicroelectronics Third-Quarter Beats Hopes
item.description: STMicroelectronics reported above-forecast revenue and gross margin for the third quarter led by growth at its automotive division that offset weak sales at its personal electronics business.

item.title: BNP Paribas Profit Fall Worse Than Expected
item.description: BNP Paribas reported a lower third-quarter net profit despite revenue growth that exceeded analysts’ expectations, as expenses climbed.

item.title: Standard Chartered Profit Slides on Impairments, Costs
item.description: Standard Chartered’s third-quarter underlying net profit dropped 30%, weighed by higher impairment and operating expenses, but topline growth rose 6% on an improved net interest margin and a strong wealth-management recovery.

item.title: At Least 22 People Killed in Maine Shootings, Federal Law-Enforcement Official Says
item.description: An active shooter late Wednesday prompted calls to shelter in place.

item.title: USD/SGD Rises Amid Mostly Higher Treasury Yields
item.description: USD/SGD rose in the afternoon Asian session amid mostly higher Treasury yields, which boost the appeal of U.S. fixed-income assets and demand for the greenback.

item.title: U.K. Car Manufacturing Sees Best September Since 2020
item.description: U.K. car manufacturing saw its strongest growth of the year so far in September and its best performance in three years, leading to a 15% rise in production for the first nine months of 2023..

item.title: At 'Little Gaza,' Israeli Soldiers Await the Order to Invade
item.description: The Israeli military has built a replica of a generic Palestinian village, where soldiers train for combat against armed terrorists in narrow streets and a labyrinth of tunnels.

item.title: Xi Jinping Is Looking for Someone to Blame for China's Property Bust
item.description: On the prowl for villains, Beijing expands real-estate probe to financial institutions.

item.title: Chinese leader Xi met with California Gov. Newsom in Beijing, part of a Chinese charm offensive that appears to be laying the groundwork for Xi to meet with Biden soon.
item.description: Chinese leader Xi met with California Gov. Newsom in Beijing, part of a Chinese charm offensive that appears to be laying the groundwork for Xi to meet with Biden soon.

item.title: New York City officials have discussed distributing tents to newly arriving migrants and creating encampments in parks and other outdoor spaces.
item.description: New York City officials have discussed distributing tents to newly arriving migrants and creating encampments in parks and other outdoor spaces.
